caption: Table 1: Comparison of the diameter-to-strong-convexity (|D|/µ) ratio with prior results in DGFs for EFGs, where the “Norm pair” indicates the primal norm used in establishing the strong convexity, and its dual. "Max gradient norm" indicates the maximum norm—measured in the dual of the norm with respect to which each DGF is strongly convex—of any reward vector, or the gradient of utility function, that can be encountered during optimization, assuming that all payoffs at the terminal nodes of the EFG are in the range [0, 1]. D denotes the depth of the tree, ||Q||1 the tree size (see Section 3), |A| the maximum number of actions, and |V| the number of reduced normal-form strategies. We remark that ln |V| ≤ O(||Q||1 log |A|).
description: This table compares the diameter-to-strong-convexity ratio (|D|/µ) of different distance-generating functions (DGFs) for extensive-form games (EFGs). It shows the ratio for Dilated Entropy, Dilated Global Entropy, and the proposed DilEnt, along with the norm pairs used and the maximum gradient norm.  The table highlights that DilEnt achieves the best ratio (up to logarithmic factors).
section: Metric Properties of the DilEnt Regularizer and Improved Regret Bounds

caption: Table 1: Comparison of the diameter-to-strong-convexity (|D|/µ) ratio with prior results in DGFs for EFGs, where the “Norm pair” indicates the primal norm used in establishing the strong convexity, and its dual. "Max gradient norm" indicates the maximum norm—measured in the dual of the norm with respect to which each DGF is strongly convex—of any reward vector, or the gradient of utility function, that can be encountered during optimization, assuming that all payoffs at the terminal nodes of the EFG are in the range [0, 1]. D denotes the depth of the tree, ||Q||₁ the tree size (see Section 3), |A| the maximum number of actions, and |V| the number of reduced normal-form strategies. We remark that ln |V| ≤ O(||Q||₁ log |A|).
description: This table compares several distance-generating functions (DGFs) used in first-order methods for solving extensive-form games. It shows the diameter-to-strong-convexity ratio (a key parameter affecting algorithm performance) for each DGF, along with the primal and dual norms used in the analysis, and the maximum gradient norm.  The table highlights the improved ratio achieved by the DilEnt (Dilated Entropy) DGF proposed in the paper.
section: Metric Properties of the DilEnt Regularizer and Improved Regret Bounds
